intro: Isolepis stricta, commonly known as slender spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetlands and marshy areas. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces dense, cylindrical spikes of small, usually greenish or brownish flowers. Isolepis stricta typically grows in shallow water or moist soils, and it plays a role in stabilizing aquatic environments. Its structure and growth habits make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
